description: From Middle English luxurious, from Old French luxurios (modern French luxurieux), from Latin luxuriosus (“rank, luxuriant, profuse, excessive, immoderate”), from luxuria (“rankness, luxury”), from luxus (“extravagance, luxury”).

adjectives.description: luxurious (comparative more luxurious, superlative most luxurious)

entries.meaning: Very fine in quality and comfortable.
